translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Paduma and Kesara as the Elders
“In the past, in the assembly of seers,
Through the faith of the Great Seer,🔽I scattered a lotus and a kesara flower.
Among the best of the Independent Buddhas,
who were so purified of anger,
I purified my mind towards them,
and for an eon I rejoiced in heaven.
I scattered a kesara flower then;
I do not know of any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
and the eight liberations as well,
the six supernormal knowledges have been realized,
the Buddha's instruction has been done.🔽Thus did the Elder Padumakesara relate these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā padumakesariyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Padumakesariyattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
